com.diffplug.common.rx

Class Breaker<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.diffplug.common.rx.Breaker<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Box<T>, IObservable<T>, RxBox<T>, RxGetter<T>, Consumer<T>, Supplier<T>

    public class Breaker<T>
extends Object
    A mechanism for "turning off" an existing `RxBox`, much like a a circuit breaker. Useful for cases where some RxBox.enforce(java.util.function.Function) calls are causing a problem during a major change, and you'd like to be able to open the circuit, fix things up, then close it again to resume operation. A `Breaker` is an `RxBox` which wraps another `RxBox`. So long as the breaker is closed, calling `set` on either the `Breaker` or the wrapped box will set both of them. Once you call `setClosed(false)`, the two boxes are separate. You can still modify the `Breaker` and its wrapped box, but they will not affect each other. When you call `setClosed(true)`, the wrapped box will be set to the value of the `Breaker`, and all future changes will again be synchronized.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.diffplug.common.base.Box

    • Field Detail

    • Method Detail

      • setClosed

        public void setClosed(boolean closed)
        Sets that this breaker is closed or open. - If the breaker is already in the given state, nothing happens. - If the breaker changes to closed, the wrapped box is to the value of `Breaker`, and future changes to either are synchronized. - If the breaker changes to open, all future changes to either box are not synchronized.
